citation.article-title: A novel lineage of sulfate-reducing microorganisms: Thermodesulfobiaceae fam. nov., Thermodesulfobium narugense, gen. nov., sp. nov., a new thermophilic isolate from a hot spring.

p.s: Thermodesulfobiaceae (Ther.mo.de.sul.fo.bia.ce.ae. Gr. adj. thermos hot; L. pref. de from; L. n. sulfur sulfur; Gr. n. bios life; L. aceae denoting a family; L. neut. n. Thermodesulfobiaceae a family of thermophilic organisms that reduces a sulfur compound)
Rod-shaped, non-sporulating and Gram-staining negative cells.
Growth occurs by anaerobic respiration with sulfate and nitrate as electron acceptors.
Represent a distinct phylogenetic lineage based on 16S rRNA gene sequence comparison.
